title: Age of Henrico’s structures
text:
A recent tweet showed the age of the buildings in Groningen, Netherlands super-imposed on LiDAR data for some perspective.

This got me thinking – what would Henrico look like? I’m going to take the cheap way out and not mess with LiDAR at the moment, but the county provides their Tax Parcels and CAMA Data for easy download.

library(arrow)
library(geoarrow)
library(dplyr)

hc_parcels <-
  open_dataset('data/geo/henrico_parcels.parquet') |> 
  select(YEAR_BUILT, geometry) |> 
  filter(!is.na(YEAR_BUILT) & YEAR_BUILT > 1500 & YEAR_BUILT < 2100) |> 
  geoarrow_collect_sf()


library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = hc_parcels) +
  geom_sf(aes(fill = YEAR_BUILT), lwd = 0, color = NA)+
  scale_fill_viridis_c(direction = -1, option  = 'turbo') +
  labs(fill = 'Year built') +
  theme_dark() +
  theme(legend.position = c(0.25, 0.25))

But how will the fish react?

title: Create: Interesting parcels and their access points
text:
Owners of Henrico parcels can be seen if clicking on “Real Estate Data” in the GIS Viewer, but don’t seem to be available via the GeoData site. Luckily the real estate search is API-friendly.

library(httr); library(rvest)

henrico_owner <- function(gpin){
  url <- paste0(
    'https://realestate.henrico.us/ords/cam/f?p=510101:5:::NO::P5_PARCEL_ID,P5_SEARCH_TYPE:',
    gpin,
    ',0'
  )
  
  real_estate_info <- GET(url)
  
  data.frame(
    gpin = gpin,
    owner = real_estate_info|> 
    content() |> 
    html_element(
      xpath = 'body/form/table[3]/tr/td[1]/table[1]/tr/td[2]/table/tr[2]/td/table/tr[7]/td[2]') |> 
    html_text()
  )
}

Filter Varina parcels by voting districts.

library(dplyr);library(arrow); library(sf); library(geoarrow)

districts <- read_sf('data/geo/voting precincts/voting_precincts.shp',
                     query = "select * from Voting_Precincts where
                     PRECINCT_N = 'Montrose' OR
                     PRECINCT_N = 'Adams'") |> 
  st_union()


varina <- open_dataset('data/geo/henrico_parcels.parquet') |>
  filter(MAGISTER_1 == 'Varina') |> 
  geoarrow_collect_sf()

montrose <- st_intersection(varina, st_transform(districts, st_crs(varina)))


library(future.apply)
plan(multisession)

parcel_owners <- future_lapply(montrose$GPIN, henrico_owner) |> 
  bind_rows()

write.csv(parcel_owners, 'data/gep/montrose_parcel_owners.csv')


parcel_owners <- read.csv('data/montrose_parcel_owners.csv')


parcels <- parcel_owners |> 
  filter(grepl('^RICHMOND (DEVELOPMENT|HOMES)|CHESAPEAKE BAY', owner) |
           gpin %in% c('808-717-3392',
                       '807-717-7478',
                       '807-717-1292',
                       '806-718-7211',
                       '806-717-5171',
                       '806-717-1889',
                       '808-717-6457'))
parcels <- montrose |> 
  right_join(parcels, by = c('GPIN' = 'gpin')) |> 
  mutate(owner = ifelse(is.na(owner), 'GILLIES CREEK INDUSTRIAL RECYCLING LLC',
                        owner))

write_sf(parcels, 'data/geo/parcels.gpkg')


access_pts <- data.frame(
  matrix(
    c(-77.385338, 37.523702, "richmond development, inc",
      -77.392297, 37.525004, 'ivester, david',
      -77.384438, 37.529007, 'montrose, graham',
      -77.383748, 37.525491, 'richmond development, inc',
      -77.382565,  37.525508, 'richmond development, inc',
      -77.383011, 37.522102, 'herrera martinez yumira',
      -77.394685, 37.525799, 'workmens cemetery',
      -77.380802, 37.527383, 'virginia tech'
    ),
    ncol = 3, byrow = T
  )
) |> 
  st_as_sf(coords = c('X1', 'X2'), crs = 4326)

write_sf(access_pts, 'data/geo/access_pts.gpkg')
